deDE: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
enGB: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
esES: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
frFR: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
itIT: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
ptBR: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
ruRU: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.
zhCN: Some kineticists form especially strong bonds with nature itself, than any specific element.

deDE:
At 1st level, a kineticist can overexert herself to channel more power than normal, pushing past the limit of what is safe for her mind by accepting burn. Some of her wild talents allow her to accept burn in exchange for a greater effect, while others require her to accept a certain amount of burn to use that talent at all. For each point of burn she accepts –2 on Charisma-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
 A kineticist can accept only 1 point of burn per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This limit rises to 2 points of burn at 6th level, and rises by 1 additional point every 3 levels thereafter. A kineticist can't choose to accept burn if it would put her total number of points of burn higher than (3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier), though she can be forced to accept more burn from a source outside her control

deDE: At level 4 a Kinetic Ranger conections with the natural world manifests itself as an animal companion.
